result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with A.Z.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: 90 days STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 40 hours (20 hrs per each year of probation) of uncompensated community service for a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs.  (fine/costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Cory J Adams in court with attorney Alli M Pedersen.  Defendant Cory J Adams in custody.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.  Defense gives sentencing argument. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 4, 2018 at 10:00 am.

DC Jail request for sentence modification - Defendant requests sentence credit, asks court to lift no contact with AZ.  Court responds:  serving probation conditional jail time. No credit. Contact with AZ up to your probation agent. If agent suggests amending to no violent contact, I'll agree.  DTE

Defendant Cory J Adams in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon.  Colleen Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Cory J Adams in court with attorney Shane Laughton Brabazon. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges. Defense requests plea/sentencing date. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Brabazon's assistant advising Atty Brabazon is sick, requesting to reschedule todays hearing. Court reschedules.
Status conference on December 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
